text: <@U1KJY9BJQ>: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2683/> is merged.
Thank You!
<@U16A62N2D|alexliusch> has joined the channel
<@U11MANG9G> i still have a problem. the version i used is v0.6..where is the CA generating service/process?
That’s the membership services component.
There is a `/membersrvc/` folder with the code.
It builds and outputs a binary as part of the `make` procedure. That’s the service (process)
Do you see it?
Can you find it?
yeah i found it
OK, `that’s the bunny`! :wink:
So when you request TCerts and ECerts…. they come out of that service/process.
[Now, *be careful* (if it’s a “live” system or so), as I don’t have the full visibility of what exactly you are doing….]
If you are just playing/developing… then you can see that you can stop that process and restart it… easily.
thats ok.i am on my testing env now
As for the point you mentioned in fabric-dev, it does not affect the ‘chain'
Even in 0.6, these processes are separate.
Fabric v1 made it a lot more explicit and moved the logic not just physically into folders… but even to a separate repo.
(among other things, for clarifying the separation)
But you can still work with 0.6 happily. I’m still on it for some stuff.
It works!
will the v1.0 come soon?
It’s under development (the `master` branch)
Should be officially released in March 2017.
According to the published schedule...
um....the ```membersrvc``` i have found.but i can’t find a binary file in it..it contains ```ca  Dockerfile  membersrvc.yaml  protos  server.go```
AFAICT, we are getting there.
Look at your go bin directory
If you have it running, then you must of a `membersrvc` binary somewhere.
yeah i have membersrvc service running.let me search..
Sure thing. I gotta head out, but I think you can do it. Otherwise, others can assist, and/or I’ll be back a bit later.
<@U11MANG9G>  greatly appreciated!
i ll try it tmr and tell u the result.thx, <@U11MANG9G>

FYI, I pushed a changeset to add LDAP support to COP.  This means the COP server authenticates users against LDAP prior to enrollment and  gets user attributes via LDAP query.   See <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3055>
